summary: Internal FBI email forwarding a July 12, 2019 message regarding approval for emergency funding to provide counseling services to victims of Jeffrey Epstein through the FBI's Victim Services Division, noting that AD has agreed to fund up to six sessions if state crime compensation programs won't cover them due to time lapsed since the crimes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victims are the subject of the email regarding counseling services funding.

events.title: Approval for Epstein Victims Counseling Funding
events.description: Internal communication indicates AD has agreed to use emergency funding for up to six counseling sessions for victims of Jeffrey Epstein if state crime compensation programs deny coverage due to time lapsed since the crimes.

events.title: Forwarding of Victims Counseling Email
events.description: Email is forwarded internally within the FBI regarding the counseling funding approval for Epstein victims.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division was involved in arranging counseling for Jeffrey Epstein's victims in July 2019.
Emergency funding was approved for up to six counseling sessions for victims if state crime compensation programs denied coverage due to the time elapsed since the crimes occurred.
The document indicates the FBI was actively addressing victim support needs following Epstein's arrest and the renewed investigation into his crimes.
The email highlights bureaucratic processes within the FBI for victim assistance, requiring approval through program managers and victim services coordinators.
The communication is marked as confidential and internal to the FBI, not to be released outside without prior authorization.
